channel.title: Question
channel.description:
ok i know i'm a noob and all at hacking and programming. but pretty experience with servers and OS crap. w/e. but when i came here, it looked like these clients such as Aryab (however you spell it) were used so you can get all the stuff you want for RS2 onto your account and then when you go on the real world it would ahve all the money and what not you had before. i mean is that what it is? when i downloaded it and all, it didnt really seem to work that well if at all.
i mean is it possible for at least one of the clients to download the character data of the specified username from runescape.com, then host it on the private server, they do what they need to do, and then have the character data uploaded to the user server at RS.com? i mean, thats what i thought this would be the only point of hacking it all right? idk..i've tried more than one route here and either it doesn't work or i dont understand [i]what[/i] to do.
ya i know there probably was a tutorial. just maybe if i can have an overall description or just where to look specifically on the forums and if thats possible. thanks.

ok thanks. maybe not then :\

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

Back in RSC a massive exploit was discovered, which allowed people to basically “create” items. Of course, it was fixed soon, and lots of accounts banned, but still a lot of cloned phats remained. This, however, was because the server didn’t use to check if a certain packet it received was legitimate. A similar exploit, was the one that allowed people to attack banker NPCs.
These exploits, however, are just based on server bugs (failure to check the legitimity of the content of certain packets), and they are very hard to find, especially without a proper packet sniffer / sender tool, and in fact it is well possible that Jagex managed to get rid of all of these exploitable bugs.

Note that a character uploading exploit has close to none chances of existing because the only character uploading is done from the Server to the Database, there is no server packet check that could fail. Besides, even if Jagex was on drugs, and they had overlooked an exploit (which here is kinda impossible anyway) we couldn’t discover it (without actually attacking their servers, which you better don’t do…), as it all takes place behind the scenes. A character uploading exploit is supposed to have existed in Blizzard Entertainment’s Diablo 2, but it’s just a rumour, and it would have been caused by a different reason.

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @fearospher fearospher
item.description:
@fearospher wrote:

depends if you call {recieving data from the server that i’m guessing already sends it, its just the pc doenst save it. but now save the data, edit the data, then send it back to the server} attacking the server. plus the servers are supposedly like the most secure out there. dude they’re just linux servers with several firewalls. they are said to be impossible to hack. but this isnt really hacking. just playing my version of the game. all i have to do is CLOSELY look at a lot of the client files’ codes. i might see something that’ll work. so ya um… i’m still trying to get SCAR working but theres all these errors and stuff… w/e

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @zstars zstars
item.description:
@zstars wrote:

fearospher:

alright, one more question. now rumor has it that jagex has linux servers. is this a true statement?

(...) Systems Administrator Jagex Ltd, developer and publisher of the MMORPG adventure game RuneScape, is looking for a systems administrator who will be able to maintain and support the systems we have in place to host our game.

The Systems Administration Team is responsible for creating, supporting and maintaining the Servers based across the world, by liaising with the hosting companies, and also facilitating the systems we currently have in place at our multiple working locations.

The opportunity will be ideal for anyone who has strong knowledge of Server technology, primarily UNIX / LINUX, be able to prioritise jobs accordingly and work to very tight deadlines.

You will be working in a fast paced development environment so the ability to be flexible and adaptable is a must.

Key duties include:

* Maintaining remote and locally hosted Linux servers;
* Work closely with hosting companies to ensure smooth running of the remotely hosted operations;
* Working within the sysadmin team to design and implement solutions to a wide variety of system administration problems.

(…)

Read full topic

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Aryan and all other previous and future java bots are just programs used to automate work on the character, in other words they would mine, fish, chop, farm or whatever you wrote a script for them to do. They never made items or anything like that.

I heard somewhere that jagex runs Debian (linux) on their servers, but I don’t know if it is true, and it doesn’t really affect much of anything.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @fearospher fearospher
item.description:

alright, one more question. now rumor has it that jagex has linux servers. is this a true statement?

item.title: Question
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

no, the accessing of player info is server side. just like it is in the craptastic servers. You can not manipulate it server side, only client side. its possible for you to get lucky and find a exploit somewhere to gain experience i suppose, but most things are blocked with simple checks server side.

Read full topic
